pullRequest.body:
Use `Nat` specialized theorems, and `omega`, where necessary to avoid needing to import the abstract ordered algebra hierarchy for basic results about `List`.

Import graph between `Mathlib.Order.Basic` and `Mathlib.Data.List.Basic`:
* [before.pdf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/files/14646805/before.pdf)
* [after.pdf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/files/14646804/after.pdf)

nodes.body: :v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0e18eb6f-fa4f-4e60-9666-ed31b43ae7d4/to/eef6b03a-de8e-4556-9253-58d3c78c6448) against commit 1640667583db65dab892533b0059dac5c0a67270.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8340876108/job/22825742682)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8340876108/job/22825742280)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8340876108/job/22825742479)
What happened here? Shouldn't this have stayed the same?
I just ran `shake --update`. I don't think it matters much.

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Monoid.Canonical.Defs
import Mathlib.Data.List.Infix
import Mathlib.Data.List.MinMax
import Mathlib.Data.List.EditDistance.Defs
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Data/List/Basic): minimize imports
